title: Blackbody - incident and emitted rad at equilbrm

content.question: An object that can be modeled as a blackbody is in equilibrium at a constant nonzero temperature. Which of the following claims about the radiation incident upon and emitted from the blackbody is correct?

choices.label: The object is transmitting all incident radiation, but not emitting any radiation of its own.
The object is reflecting all incident radiation, but not emitting any radiation of its own.
The object is absorbing all incident radiation, and also emitting radiation at the same rate that radiation is absorbed.
The object is reflecting all incident radiation, and also emitting radiation at the same rate that radiation is reflected.

content.answer: The object is absorbing all incident radiation, and also emitting radiation at the same rate that radiation is absorbed.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
